subject: Sales
title: Mirroring and Rapport
description: A quick win: understand Mirroring and Rapport.

hook.text: A sales rep mirrors her client's posture. He leans forward, she leans forward. The deal closes fast.

buildup.text: Mirroring is the unconscious dance of connection. We naturally copy people we like.

discovery.text: FBI negotiators use it on purpose. Match pace, tone, and body language to build instant rapport.

twist.text: Overdo it and you look like a parrot. Subtle matching works. Obvious copying backfires.

climax.text: When mirroring works, both sides feel understood. We buy from people who get us.

punchline.text: Match the rhythm. Build the bond. Close the deal.

quiz.question: Which profession deliberately uses mirroring in negotiations?
